comments.body: Looks like you should update DataFrameWriter.scala, functions.scala, functions.py, etc related codes. cc @rdblue, @brkyvz and @zero323 FYI

nit: `SortValue` sounds somehow confusing to me. Affected by the catalyst `SortOrder`, seems `SortOrder` sounds better. However you already define `SortOrder` as interface. Not strong option, can be ignored if you think it's okay.

I am open to alternatives here for sure.

It seems like we are giving synonyms in this file. For example, `FieldReference` implements `NamedReference`. Unfortunately, I cannot use `SortOrder` as it is already taken in the public expression API.
For internal API, I think it is more convenient to use NamedReference directly.
yup, quoting an already parsed column name and parse it again is pretty tricky.
It would be good to use a different name to distinguish this from the case where the reference name is parsed. What about updating the other one to `parseReference`?
